page.title: 05HOUSING IN MORFA BYCHAN
page.content: Morfa Bychan is a scattered village consisting of 312 high quality houses. Traditional stone-built houses and cottages flank two main roads,both of which lead to the beach.Several unadopted roads branch off these roads.Before 1960 lack of mains drainage meant few other properties were built.To allow further housing, developers built treatment plants serving five private estates,and in 1984 a sewage scheme was started to serve the whole village.New buildings are constructed of brick and breeze block and,in accordance with planning regulations,are rendered with cement which is faced or colour-washed.The new houses are roofed with local slate except for 5 timber houses which have iron roofs.
